intro: Cyrtostachys microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf bamboo, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, pale yellow to greenish flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
